Quick Facts

EXIT   X

COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT MEASURES

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

A non-disturbance notice prevents a site from being disturbed if a notifiable incident or a particular situation or activity has occurred there. An inspector can issue this notice to a person with management or control of a workplace. The notice would arise if the inspector reasonably believes it would be necessary to exercise his or her compliance powers.

 

A non-disturbance notice must be issued for a specified time period (no more than seven days). It must outline the:

 

•

obligations on the person who is the subject of the notice

•

measures required to preserve the site or protect a disturbance of the site

•

penalty for breaching the notice

 

An individual who fails to comply with a non-disturbance notice faces a maximum penalty of $50,000. A corporation faces a maximum penalty of $250,000.

 

(Victoria: $75,835)

 

(Victoria: $379,175)
